conclusion: Analyze the flow path of the liquid from points A, B, and C.
Liquid flows downward from A, B, and C.
Liquid from A encounters the first baffle and flows towards the left.
Liquid from B encounters the second baffle and flows towards the right.
Liquid from C encounters the third baffle and flows towards the left.
Baffles are angled to direct flow either to the left or right.
Liquid from A flows left and hits the first baffle, directing it further left towards container D.
Liquid from B flows right and hits the second baffle, directing it further right towards container E.
Liquid from C flows left and hits the third baffle, directing it further left towards container D.
Liquid from A and C will flow into container D.
Liquid from B will flow into container E.
Container D will receive liquid from A and C.
Container E will receive liquid from B.
